abstract: Hans Kristian Rausing, charged with delaying the burial of his wife, Eva, is granted bail by a British court on condition that he remain at the psychiatric hospital in central London where he is receiving drug treatment.
lead_paragraph: Hans Kristian Rausing, an heir to his family’s multibillion-dollar cardboard packaging fortune, was charged Wednesday with “preventing the decent and lawful burial” of his wife, whose severely decomposed body was found in their opulent London house last week.
